required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Clinical Study Evaluating Clinical, Radiographic And Patient-Reported Outcomes Of THA With Cemented Acetabular Cups

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical study has the aim to evaluate clinical, radiographic, patient-reported outcomes of total hip arthroplasty with the implant of Mueller cemented acetabular cups up to 2 years after surgery, in order to assess the performance of the device. Furthermore, it aims to collect short-term survivorship of the implant and the incidence of early complications.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical progression of Harris Hip Score (HHS) from baseline to 2 years after surgery
primary_outcome.description: HHS ranges from 0 to 100, being 0 the worst and 100 the best conditions. HHS is reported as 90-100 for excellent results, 80-90 for good, 70-79 for fair, 60-69 for poor, and below 60 for a failed result. The outcome is considered satisfactory for values over 80

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiographic evaluation and stability assessment of the implant up to 2 years FU
Clinical progression of HOOS up to 2 years FU, compared to the baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Hip disability and osteoarthritis outcome score (HOOS) is a patient-reported outcome measurement, that ranges from 0 to 100, with 100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in TUG from preoperative up to 2 years FU
Clinical progression of HHS up to 1 year FU, compared to the baseline
Implant survivorship (Kaplan-Meier estimate) at 2 years after surgery
Incidence of device-related AE/SAE up to 2 years of follow-up

arm_group.description: Patients undergo total hip arthroplasty with the implant of the Mueller cemented cup as acetabular component.

intervention.description: Patients undergo total hip arthroplasty with the implant of Mueller cemented cups
